message.content: The sum of the first 20 positive even integers is $2+4+6+\cdots + 38 + 40$. The sum of an arithmetic series is equal to the average of the first and last term, multiplied by the number of terms, so the sum is $(1+20)\left(\frac{2+40}{2}\right) = 10\cdot 21 = 210$. Similarly, the sum of the first $n$ positive odd integers is $n^2$, so the sum of the first 15 positive odd integers is $1^2+3^2+\cdots + 29^2 + 31^2 = 15^2 = 225$. The positive difference between these two sums is $225 - 210=\boxed{15}$.
